Video tutorials
=====================


The following video explains how to install InferPy. This is done using pip in the command-line
terminal of a Jupyter environment.

.. raw:: html

   <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-3ctvoshokg" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
   <br><br><br>


This video considers a toy example, namely a linear regression, and explains how to define it with InferPy.
Then, with a sample dataset, variational inference is used to learn the parameters of the regression.


.. raw:: html

   <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D4WYQXcNO2Q" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>
   <br><br><br>
